comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: Aristides Agramonte (1868-1931), Cuban-born American bacteriologist who served on the Yellow Fever Commission of the US Army.

comment._content: NYT of June 4, 1914 query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=FB0614F63C5E13738... indicates that received an honorary degree from Columbia the day before.
